Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kinnywoman
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at this hotel end March/early April 2012. Firstly, I must say how helpful the hotel were in providing us with map and details on getting to the hotel: they were spot on. The hotel is in a great location in San Marco; less than 10 minutes walk from Rialto bridge and St Mark's square. One thing to bear in mind with this area is that there will be lots of tourists lugging their suitcases around: I had to shut the windows at night as it got a bit noisy, and I had trouble sleeping. The breakfast was of the usual continental variety: good choice of coffee, pastries, yoghurts and sad looking fruit. Don't having anything negative to add really: maybe the bedroom walls could do with a lick of paint to freshen up the room. The bathroom was nice and clean, although couldn't get jacuzzi bath to work! Not a problem for me as I'm a shower girl!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with good location!”
Reviews.Author: rolandho
Reviews.Content: Stayed in their Suite Room on Valentine's Day 2012! The room itself has a Jacuzzi:-) Breakfast is simple. Value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Kees_Ria
Reviews.Content: Centrally located. Some people complain "difficult to find", but we received an email from the hotel on how to reach them and the directions were very clear. Staff is very friendly and helpfull. Rooms comfortable and clean. Luxury bathroom. Extensive breakfast with excellent coffee-machine. Very nice hotel for reasonable price. We already booked this hotel again for March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Small place in great location”
Reviews.Author: sacw
Reviews.Content: On a small side street next to the museum with the same nam. Nice neighbourhood with small restaurants etc. Many small shops nearby and app 5 minute walk the square. Small but nice rooms, tiny bathroom, also nice! Breakfast in a little patio. The owner is fantastic and very helpful, and so is his son! Easy to get to hotel from the boat and easy to order a gondola as well

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel - very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: ilovecosmos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in September 2011 with my husband, very pleased with presentation of the hotel and the customer service from staff, who were so friendly and helpful. We had a jacuzzi bath which was a bonus as well as free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “The best location in Venizia”
Reviews.Author: AliceTaipei_Taiwan
Reviews.Content: It was great to stay in Ca' Fortuny while we made our trip to Italy in Venice. Room was great and quiet, and hotel staff was so helpful and kindness. Free wifi worked very well, and many restaurant was near by when we were hungry at night. The breakfast is the best ................ we had wonderful time in Venice and Ca' Fortuny is the key point to make us fall in love with Venice. We would like to stay this hotel if we visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: heywood417
Reviews.Content: A little tricky to find (but everything is in Venice, unless you stay right near one of the ports), but the hotel staff sent detailed directions before our trip. Hotel was fantastic. Room was good size, free wifi (just get a username & password from the front desk), TONS of electrical outlets, big bathroom (standup shower only, though, in our room). Breakfast on their outdoor patio was lovely, and I must say--I love that Italians make "Americano-style" coffee SOOO much better than actual Americans. Great selection for breakfast. Venice is quite small, & you can walk from one side of the island to the other in 15 minutes, so everything is in walking distance, & direction to the main areas (San Marcos, Realto Bridge, etc.) are well marked with signs at corners, so we never got lost & never had to look at a map after our first day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaP66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011, and were SO happy with our accommodations! The hotel is small, and can be a bit tricky to find, but the hotel had sent us a map prior to our arrival, so we just followed the twists and turns quite easily. With the exception of one small footbridge that we had to lug our suitcases up and down, the rest of the way was flat and easy to tow our bags behind us. Our room was very clean, and the bathroom was lovely! We had a jetted spa tub, and the marble floors, walls and vanity just added a beautiful touch of distinction to the room. The beds were very firm, but I much prefer that to a soft mattress anyway. The bedspread was a bit "dated" looking, and If I could offer one thing I would change, it would be that. Our breakfast was included, and we really appreciated that fabulous selection available to us each morning. There were hard boiled eggs, sliced meat, yogurt, fruit pies, quiche, canned fruit, toast, croissants, cereal, and lots of other choices, as well as coffee, tea and juice. We were able to have a lovely breakfast and then start right in on our days of exploring the beauty of Venice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We also really appreciated having the little elevator to take our bags up to our floor. Many hotels in Europe don't have elevators, and I didn't relish the though of lugging my heavy suitcases up one or two flights of stairs. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a special boutique-hotel experience in Venice. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, would go again.”
Reviews.Author: IainMarj1
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 4 night stay at CA Fortuny. Before our trip the hotel kindly gave us directions which we found very easy to follow. The hotel is quite basic but had everything we needed apart from an iron. The shower and bath were very good, and the room clean and tidy and the bed was very comfortable. The location of the hotel is one of it's best features, 5 mins walk away from San Angelo water boat stop, the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco. Some lovely restaurants nearby, with as small bar opposite. We were on the second floor and didn't get any noise from the street. The staff were polite and helpful. All in all for the money(compared to what other hotels were quoting) well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little gem in the heart of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Finbarjc421
Reviews.Content: Great location, big spacious and clean room and very reasonable prices! Lovely breakfast and staff helpful. Look forward to staying hear again on my next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find- very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and thought it was very reasonably priced and incredibly convenient for all the sights and close to the water taxi stop. Although the room was small it was immaculately clean and the owner/proprietor couldn't have been more helpful, offering advice about where to go and the best ways to get there. Breakfast was good with a range of food on offer. Overall great value for money as it is so central yet quiet- the bar opposite closed very early so there was never any noise from there (and they served very reasonably priced Prosecco so great for a pre-dinner drink)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room - fabulous bathroom”
Reviews.Author: JPB1803
Reviews.Content: We've jus arrived home after staying at Ca Fortuny for 5 nights and I couldn't wait to post a review! We found the room to be clean, stylish and very cool in the hot weather! We had plenty of space in the large economy room and the maid service was great rooms was cleaned thoroughly everyday with clean towels daily! The bathroom was beautiful with an excellent shower and jaquzi bath which was a lovely additional feature! Don't really have anything bad to say about this hotel it's a perfect location walkjg distance to St Marcs n Rialto etc and it's on a quiet side street so no noise of a night time! There is a quiet bar facing the hotel and we had a front face room right over the bat and there was no problem at all with noise! Def worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JDL003
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for my wifes 30th birthday and as it was quiet season they put us in the suite at the top of the hotel for free, it had a huge balcony, but it was mid January so was freezing in Venice. its in a really good location for exploring Venice, as the city is so small. directions from the hotel are poor, and we found it by accident. staff are lovely, breakfast was nice, its clean, room was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Breann82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel the night before we left for a Mediterranean cruise from the Venice port. The hotel was easy to find and in a great location to allow you to see all of the main attractions of Venice easily. The staff upgraded our room for free (we didn't even ask) and the free breakfast was wonderful. We wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying for an economy room”
Reviews.Author: picolina
Reviews.Content: I did not have great expectations to begin with so it was a satisfying experience. The location is great, as many have said. I could imagine however that first timers to Venice would have a bit of a hard time finding this hotel. We were given a little room on the ground floor next to the breakfast area, and I would think that some people found this room inadequate mainly because of the size. The only problem we had was that the AC stopped working on the last night that we were there. Since it was not too hot, we did not see it as a big problem and did not ask for help. The noise was not an issue at all at this hotel, this calle is relatively quiet compared to what I have seen in Venice. The bar across from the hotel is not a typical busy bar, and it closes quite early (when we get back to the hotel in the evening around 11 PM, it was already closed). Breakfast here is very good, better than most in Venice, even than the one we stayed in our last trip which was a much more expensive hotel than this one. The staff seems fine, we did not require help and had little interaction with them. In short, you pay a high price to visit Venice in the spring, and this is relatively good value.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant find!”
Reviews.Author: tremend
Reviews.Content: Fortunately I had spent time with Google Earth locating this hotel precisely and it was just a 5 minute walk from the San Angelo vaporetto stop. Perfectly sited, just off the beaten track in a quiet side street, but 10 minutes from San Marco and the Rialto. There was a nice cafe opposite where you could sup a grappa late at night! The small reception was fine, the lift very useful for bags and the breakfast room clean and tidy. It had a small open-air, shady, terrace, which was great in the hot weather we experienced. Our room was quite big with a large sofa and several mirrors. We made good use of the tea-making facilities, the TV, and internet connection. The AC was essential while we were there. The staff could not have been more helpful and all spoke enough English to assist us. We will go there again, without doubt. Venice was beautiful, of course, and the Ca'Fortuny enhanced our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great, helpful service”
Reviews.Author: Curtfulch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location! We opted for an economy room which was fairly reasonable, the room was rather small though for a 4 night stay and there is a bar directly opposite which gives off a lot of noise, including Diana Ross tunes! Other than that the staff were very welcoming and friendly, and the breakfast is of good quality and free with the room booking

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and value”
Reviews.Author: travelchick202
Reviews.Content: Overall, I had a great experience staying at Ca' Fortuny for 4 nights. The room was average but nothing to really complain about. The staff is super helpful which is a plus if you don't speak Italian or know your way around very well. Downside - no iron in room, gets a little loud outside early in the morning (around 5am). Upside - free breakfast every morning, free internet (12 hours), central location.

Reviews.Title: “Best B&B at best value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: rahulyadwadkar
Reviews.Content: 1. Great sized rooms and interiors 2. Great bathrooms - size, interiors and toiletries 3. Great breakfast 4. Great location from public water bus station and all tourist spots 5. Helpful, English speaking staff 6. Lift/elevator available

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: nomaddeb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here November with my teenager daughter. Rooms clean, jacuzzi great after walking all day. Staff very friendly and helpful. Choice of breakfast very good. Free wifi. Would highly recommend to others. Location good, quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: colmil
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the hotel, the bedroom and bathroom were superb, the staff could not have been more helpful. A little difficult to find but the instructions are very clear and its only a short walk fro the Sant Angelo Vaporetto We got the room for 247 euros for three nights B & B, an absolute steal! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, beautiful, quiet hotel in the heart of venice”
Reviews.Author: superchemist1
Reviews.Content: Ca Fortuny is a small, quiet, yet luxurious hotel in the heart of venice. Located only two blocks from the main Grand Canal ferry, and a 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco, the location is excellent. Many shops and restaurants are within a few minute walk. The hotel staff greeted us warmly, helped get internet setup for my 15-year old, and was gracious helping with concert tickets. The room was extremely comfortable, with very good AC on a very hot weekend. Refrigerator was stocked with cold beer and sodas, a welcome relief from the heat. One caution...the hotel is NOT easy to find without a map or GPS. We used a GPS, but also had instructions from the hotel website. Take the #1 water ferry, exiting at the first stop on the left after crossing under the Rialto Bridge. The entrance is barely noticable, since the hotel only has a few rooms. Directly across the street is a nice wine bar. We found this hotel to be a great value, especially with the wonderful free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth trying”
Reviews.Author: Carrabaun
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel if you are planning a visit to Venice. Hotel is in a lovely area about 10 mins walk from St Marks Square. Nice quiet area with lovely restaurants around at nighttime and just slightly off the main thoroughfare which makes it nicer. If you are too near the main attractions they tend to hike up the prices in restaurants. Hotel itself is small but very nicely presented. Small reception are but very clean and lovely friendly staff. Our room was very large with a very modern bathroom and jacuzzi bath. Breakfast was adequate (better than a lot i've stayed in Italy. Overall, i would definitely return to this hotel and would without doubt recommend it to friends. Some people have complained that you have to let yourself into the hotel after 8pm as the front door is locked but that really wasnt a hinderance to us at all and would certainly not let it put me off staying there again. The main door was open but the internal glass door was locked and you were given a key. Just thought i'd mention this in case people were put off by other reviews mentioning this

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic doesn't begin to describe ...”
Reviews.Author: Alissa C
Reviews.Content: ... our stay at the beautiful Ca' Fortuny in Venice! Just like the website says, it's a luxury guesthouse ... The rooms were HUGE, with marble floors, large beds, and jacuzzi tubs in the large bathrooms - all such a rarity for this price point in Venice/Italy! It's located conveniently near the Sant'Angelo water bus stop and is a short, 10-minute walk to St. Mark's or the Accademia bridge. The sweet, cheerful girl at the front desk was a multi-tasker - preparing breakfast while answering the phone and giving touristic guidance - and never missed a beat or dropped her smile!! The front door locks at 8:00 p.m., but you are given a front door key, so you can let yourself in/out at any time. The included breakfast is served in the dining room or out on the patio an is a great spread of breads, meats, cereals and fresh fruits. There is no internet, however the staff are happy to look anything up for you. They've also got pamphlets and recommendations for local activities available in the lobby. There is a fantastic neighborhood bar, "Teamo", directly across the way with bruschetta crostini and wine at incredibly fair prices and a very friendly (albeit Italian-speaking only) staff. We will definitely make another trip to Venice and stay in this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLeonia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is too far from the main sites and not easy to find. Upon arrival we were told that the front door is locked by 8:00PM and we basically had to become our own security guard. The door had to be opened from the inside and relocked from the outside. The room was a good size, clean bathroon but the bedroom floor was dirty. Service desk lacked in personality and knowledge. Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Lilly1965
Reviews.Content: I consider myself to be a bit of a fussy traveller, & was dubious about Ca Fortuny, but what a pleasant surprise. The staff were polite, & incredibly helpful from directions, to booking shows & a water taxi for our return, nothing was too much trouble. The hotel, although small from the outside, was very spacious inside. Ours was a lovely big room, with large bathroom & walk through area with wardrobes. Very open, airy, bright & spacious. A locals bar just across the street was ideal for an early evening snack & quick drink, but closed at a reasonable time, meaning the nights were lovely & peaceful. Location was also excellent, with a 10 minute (max) stroll to St Marks, & great restraunts within a few minutes. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough & would not hesitate to return here.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect oasis in Veenice”
Reviews.Author: Renardette
Reviews.Content: In short, the C'a Fortuny couldn't have suited us better. Lots of research told us it was the best value in San Marco for the level of hotel we wanted. The location is quiet and picturesque, yet 10 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco. The rooms [ a double and large triple] were spacious, really comfy [ 6 foot beds] with kettles, mini bar you could keep your own bits in and good bathrooms with spa baths and showers.The buffet breakfast was plentiful and really fresh - they kept replenishing it all until way after 10. The staff was so helpful and kind. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: erikaDublin
Reviews.Content: was supposed to stay in this hotel, but when we went to the san moise(a sister hotel) for directions we were told we would be staying in a different hotel as they had no rooms left. they sent us to a hotel in lido(not in Venice)it was late when we arrived and we said we didn't want to go to another hotel as we booked this one. we were told we could book another hotel, but we would have to pay for this and then try to get our money back. it was 12oc at night.. we argued for an hour and a half.. the staff were very rude. while we waited to see if they would let us stay we met FOUR other couples who were moved to a hotel they didn't book. they seem to take bookings even when they have no rooms, then just put you wherever they want.. will never go back here..

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ca' Fortuny
HotelInfo.Address: Calle della Mandola 3752, 30124 Venice, Italy
